metadata.title: SSAT Elementary Vocabulary Dataset
metadata.description: Comprehensive collection of 200 high-quality vocabulary words for SSAT Elementary Level (Grades 3-4)

difficulty_scale.1: Basic - Familiar to most grade 3-4 students

ssat_importance_scale.1: Low frequency - Rarely appears on SSAT

vocabulary.definition: the quality of having the means or skills to do something
vocabulary.example_sentence: Maria showed great ability in solving difficult math problems.

vocabulary.definition: to take in liquid, gas, or other substance
vocabulary.example_sentence: The sponge can absorb a lot of water quickly.

vocabulary.definition: belonging to times long past, very old
vocabulary.example_sentence: The students learned about ancient civilizations in Egypt.

vocabulary.definition: to move towards or come near to something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The deer slowly approached the stream to drink water.

vocabulary.definition: to put things in a particular order or position
vocabulary.example_sentence: Please arrange the books on the shelf by size.

vocabulary.definition: extremely cold, like the North Pole region
vocabulary.example_sentence: Polar bears live in the arctic climate where it's very cold.

vocabulary.definition: a way of thinking or feeling about someone or something
vocabulary.example_sentence: Jenny has a positive attitude about learning new things.

vocabulary.definition: to draw something toward oneself
vocabulary.example_sentence: Bright flowers attract bees and butterflies.

vocabulary.definition: typical or normal, not special or unusual
vocabulary.example_sentence: The average height of students in our class is four feet.

vocabulary.definition: fearless and daring, willing to take risks
vocabulary.example_sentence: It was bold of Sam to try the difficult gymnastics move.

vocabulary.definition: the edge or boundary of something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The garden has a border of colorful flowers around it.

vocabulary.definition: lasting only a short time
vocabulary.example_sentence: The teacher gave us a brief explanation before the test.

vocabulary.definition: very bright or shining intensely
vocabulary.example_sentence: The brilliant sunshine made everything look golden.

vocabulary.definition: to catch and hold someone or something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The photographer tried to capture the beautiful sunset.

vocabulary.definition: sure or confident about something
vocabulary.example_sentence: I am certain that tomorrow is Friday.

vocabulary.definition: the usual weather conditions in a place over a long time
vocabulary.example_sentence: The climate in Florida is warm and humid most of the year.

vocabulary.definition: quick to understand and learn
vocabulary.example_sentence: The clever student found a new way to solve the puzzle.

vocabulary.definition: the land near the sea or ocean
vocabulary.example_sentence: We walked along the coast and collected seashells.

vocabulary.definition: a group of people living in the same area
vocabulary.example_sentence: Our community worked together to clean up the park.

vocabulary.definition: to examine how things are similar or different
vocabulary.example_sentence: Let's compare these two books to see which one is better.

vocabulary.definition: to think about carefully
vocabulary.example_sentence: Please consider my suggestion before making a decision.

vocabulary.definition: to hold or include something inside
vocabulary.example_sentence: This box contains all my favorite toys.

vocabulary.definition: one of the seven large land masses on Earth
vocabulary.example_sentence: Africa is the continent where lions and elephants live.

vocabulary.definition: to make someone believe something is true
vocabulary.example_sentence: I tried to convince my mom to let me stay up late.

vocabulary.definition: a person who is easily frightened
vocabulary.example_sentence: Don't be a coward; try the roller coaster with us!

vocabulary.definition: a traditional way of doing something
vocabulary.example_sentence: It's a custom in our family to have pancakes on Sunday morning.

vocabulary.definition: to protect someone or something from harm
vocabulary.example_sentence: The mother bird will defend her nest from danger.

vocabulary.definition: easily broken or damaged; fragile
vocabulary.example_sentence: Handle the delicate butterfly wings very carefully.

vocabulary.definition: to tell what something is like using words
vocabulary.example_sentence: Can you describe what your lost dog looks like?

vocabulary.definition: to grow or change into something better
vocabulary.example_sentence: Plants develop from tiny seeds into full-grown flowers.

vocabulary.definition: a simple drawing that explains how something works
vocabulary.example_sentence: The diagram showed how to build the model airplane.

vocabulary.definition: far away in space or time
vocabulary.example_sentence: We could see the distant mountains on the horizon.

vocabulary.definition: all the living and non-living things in an area that work together
vocabulary.example_sentence: The forest ecosystem includes trees, animals, and soil.

vocabulary.definition: graceful and stylish in appearance or manner
vocabulary.example_sentence: The swan moved across the water in an elegant way.

vocabulary.definition: to make it possible for someone to do something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The wheelchair ramp will enable everyone to enter the building.

vocabulary.definition: the power to do work or make things happen
vocabulary.example_sentence: Solar panels collect energy from the sun.

vocabulary.definition: to look at something carefully and closely
vocabulary.example_sentence: The doctor will examine your throat to see why it hurts.

vocabulary.definition: something that happens to you or something you do
vocabulary.example_sentence: Going to the zoo was an exciting experience for the children.

vocabulary.definition: to travel to new places to learn about them
vocabulary.example_sentence: The astronauts will explore the surface of Mars.

vocabulary.definition: causing death or disaster
vocabulary.example_sentence: The knight avoided the dragon's fatal fire breath.

vocabulary.definition: showing strong, violent feeling or energy
vocabulary.example_sentence: The fierce storm knocked down several trees.

vocabulary.definition: able to bend easily without breaking
vocabulary.example_sentence: Rubber bands are flexible and can stretch.

vocabulary.definition: having good luck
vocabulary.example_sentence: We were fortunate to find our lost cat quickly.

vocabulary.definition: remains of an ancient plant or animal preserved in rock
vocabulary.example_sentence: We found a dinosaur fossil in the museum.

vocabulary.definition: weak and easily damaged
vocabulary.example_sentence: The frail old bridge couldn't support heavy trucks.

vocabulary.definition: extremely angry
vocabulary.example_sentence: Mom was furious when she saw the messy kitchen.

vocabulary.definition: a round object that shows the Earth
vocabulary.example_sentence: We used the globe to find Australia in geography class.

vocabulary.definition: happening slowly over time
vocabulary.example_sentence: There was a gradual change in the weather as winter approached.

vocabulary.definition: the force that pulls things toward the Earth
vocabulary.example_sentence: Gravity makes the ball fall down when you drop it.

vocabulary.definition: the natural home of an animal or plant
vocabulary.example_sentence: The rainforest is the natural habitat of many colorful birds.

vocabulary.definition: rough, unpleasant, or severe
vocabulary.example_sentence: The harsh winter made it difficult for animals to find food.

vocabulary.definition: an educated guess about what might happen
vocabulary.example_sentence: My hypothesis is that plants grow faster with more sunlight.

vocabulary.definition: to recognize and name someone or something
vocabulary.example_sentence: Can you identify which bird is making that sound?

vocabulary.definition: the force of one thing hitting another
vocabulary.example_sentence: The impact of the meteor created a large crater.

vocabulary.definition: belonging to one person, separate and distinct
vocabulary.example_sentence: Each student has their own individual desk.

vocabulary.definition: having the ability to learn and understand quickly
vocabulary.example_sentence: Dolphins are intelligent animals that can solve problems.

vocabulary.definition: to plan or mean to do something
vocabulary.example_sentence: I intend to finish my homework before dinner.

vocabulary.definition: a trip from one place to another
vocabulary.example_sentence: Our journey to the mountains took three hours by car.

vocabulary.definition: to send something into the air or water with force
vocabulary.example_sentence: NASA will launch the rocket to Mars next month.

vocabulary.definition: the furthest point or greatest amount allowed
vocabulary.example_sentence: The speed limit on this road is 25 miles per hour.

vocabulary.definition: to find the exact position of something
vocabulary.example_sentence: We used a map to locate the treasure.

vocabulary.definition: faithful and devoted to someone or something
vocabulary.example_sentence: My loyal dog always waits for me to come home.

vocabulary.definition: extremely beautiful or impressive
vocabulary.example_sentence: The magnificent castle stood tall on the hilltop.

vocabulary.definition: a particular way of doing something
vocabulary.example_sentence: She has a special method for solving math problems.

vocabulary.definition: a natural substance found in the earth
vocabulary.example_sentence: Salt is a mineral that we use to flavor food.

vocabulary.definition: great unhappiness or suffering
vocabulary.example_sentence: The lost puppy's misery ended when it found its family.

vocabulary.definition: small amounts of water in the air or on surfaces
vocabulary.example_sentence: Plants need moisture from the soil to grow properly.

vocabulary.definition: to confuse or puzzle someone completely
vocabulary.example_sentence: The magician's trick will mystify the audience.

vocabulary.definition: a country with its own government
vocabulary.example_sentence: The United States is a nation made up of fifty states.

vocabulary.definition: to watch carefully and notice details
vocabulary.example_sentence: Scientists observe animals to learn about their behavior.

vocabulary.definition: someone who competes against you
vocabulary.example_sentence: The chess player studied her opponent's moves carefully.

vocabulary.definition: completely different or contrary
vocabulary.example_sentence: Hot and cold are opposite temperatures.

vocabulary.definition: a painful or difficult experience
vocabulary.example_sentence: Getting lost in the woods was quite an ordeal for the hikers.

vocabulary.definition: the beginning or source of something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The origin of the river is high up in the mountains.

vocabulary.definition: the result or consequence of something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The outcome of the game was a victory for our team.

vocabulary.definition: a section of text or a way through something
vocabulary.example_sentence: Please read the passage and answer the questions.

vocabulary.definition: able to wait calmly without getting upset
vocabulary.example_sentence: Be patient while I explain the math problem step by step.

vocabulary.definition: to do or carry out an action
vocabulary.example_sentence: The band will perform their new song at the concert.

vocabulary.definition: to convince someone to do or believe something
vocabulary.example_sentence: I tried to persuade my sister to help me with chores.

vocabulary.definition: a large object in space that orbits the sun
vocabulary.example_sentence: Mars is the fourth planet from the sun.

vocabulary.definition: giving a feeling of happiness or satisfaction
vocabulary.example_sentence: The garden had a pleasant smell of roses.

vocabulary.definition: the number of people living in a place
vocabulary.example_sentence: Our town has a population of about 5,000 people.

vocabulary.definition: to say what you think will happen in the future
vocabulary.example_sentence: Can you predict which team will win the championship?

vocabulary.definition: to stop something from happening
vocabulary.example_sentence: Wearing a helmet can prevent head injuries while biking.

vocabulary.definition: first in order of importance
vocabulary.example_sentence: Safety is the primary concern when crossing the street.

vocabulary.definition: a special right or advantage
vocabulary.example_sentence: It's a privilege to represent our school in the spelling bee.

vocabulary.definition: a series of actions to achieve a result
vocabulary.example_sentence: Making bread is a process that takes several hours.

vocabulary.definition: a living thing that makes its own food
vocabulary.example_sentence: Plants are producers because they make food from sunlight.

vocabulary.definition: the reason for doing something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The purpose of studying is to learn new things.

vocabulary.definition: not found or seen very often
vocabulary.example_sentence: Finding a four-leaf clover is rare and considered lucky.

vocabulary.definition: to identify someone or something you have seen before
vocabulary.example_sentence: I recognize that song from the movie we watched.

vocabulary.definition: a particular area or part of a country
vocabulary.example_sentence: The desert region gets very little rain each year.

vocabulary.definition: to depend on someone or something
vocabulary.example_sentence: Plants rely on sunlight and water to grow.

vocabulary.definition: to fix something that is broken
vocabulary.example_sentence: The mechanic will repair our car's broken engine.

vocabulary.definition: a feeling of admiration for someone
vocabulary.example_sentence: Students should show respect for their teachers.

vocabulary.definition: able to be trusted to do what is right
vocabulary.example_sentence: My responsible older brother takes care of our pets.

vocabulary.definition: to turn something around or go backwards
vocabulary.example_sentence: She had to reverse the car out of the driveway.

vocabulary.definition: very silly or unreasonable
vocabulary.example_sentence: It would be ridiculous to wear shorts in a snowstorm.

vocabulary.definition: to spread things over a wide area
vocabulary.example_sentence: The wind will scatter the autumn leaves across the yard.

vocabulary.definition: a plan that shows when things will happen
vocabulary.example_sentence: According to our schedule, we have math class at 10 AM.

vocabulary.definition: formed from layers of materials that settled over time
vocabulary.example_sentence: Sandstone is a sedimentary rock made from sand particles.

vocabulary.definition: easily affected by small changes
vocabulary.example_sentence: My sensitive skin gets sunburned very quickly.

vocabulary.definition: a place that provides protection from weather
vocabulary.example_sentence: The cave provided shelter from the heavy rain.

vocabulary.definition: a sign or sound that gives information
vocabulary.example_sentence: The traffic light signal tells drivers when to stop and go.

vocabulary.definition: alike but not exactly the same
vocabulary.example_sentence: These two puppies look similar but have different colored spots.

vocabulary.definition: to sleep peacefully
vocabulary.example_sentence: The baby continued to slumber despite the noise outside.

vocabulary.definition: an answer to a problem
vocabulary.example_sentence: We found a solution to fix the leaky pipe.

vocabulary.definition: to suffer or die from lack of food
vocabulary.example_sentence: Without rain, the crops will starve for water.

vocabulary.definition: to trip or fall while walking
vocabulary.example_sentence: Be careful not to stumble over those rocks on the path.

vocabulary.definition: right or appropriate for a particular purpose
vocabulary.example_sentence: This warm coat is suitable for cold winter weather.

vocabulary.definition: to examine or look at something carefully
vocabulary.example_sentence: The scientist will survey the forest to count the different trees.

vocabulary.definition: moving very quickly
vocabulary.example_sentence: The swift cheetah can run faster than any other land animal.

vocabulary.definition: something that represents or stands for something else
vocabulary.example_sentence: The dove is a symbol of peace in many cultures.

vocabulary.definition: to deal with or work on a difficult problem
vocabulary.example_sentence: Let's tackle this challenging math problem together.

vocabulary.definition: a natural ability to do something well
vocabulary.example_sentence: Sarah has a talent for drawing beautiful pictures.

vocabulary.definition: an idea that explains how or why something happens
vocabulary.example_sentence: Scientists have a theory about how dinosaurs became extinct.

vocabulary.definition: a feeling of excitement and pleasure
vocabulary.example_sentence: Riding the roller coaster gave me such a thrill!

vocabulary.definition: something very valuable and precious
vocabulary.example_sentence: The pirates buried their treasure on a secret island.

vocabulary.definition: a great victory or success
vocabulary.example_sentence: Winning the championship was a triumph for our soccer team.

vocabulary.definition: showing the usual characteristics of something
vocabulary.example_sentence: A typical day at school includes math, reading, and science.

vocabulary.definition: to join together or become one
vocabulary.example_sentence: The two classes will unite to perform the school play.

vocabulary.definition: not normal or common; strange
vocabulary.example_sentence: It's unusual to see snow in July in most places.

vocabulary.definition: worth a lot of money or very useful
vocabulary.example_sentence: The valuable diamond necklace sparkled in the light.

vocabulary.definition: something used to transport people or things
vocabulary.example_sentence: A bicycle is a vehicle that doesn't need gasoline.

vocabulary.definition: the ability to see
vocabulary.example_sentence: Eagles have excellent vision and can spot prey from far away.

vocabulary.definition: someone who helps without being paid
vocabulary.example_sentence: My mom is a volunteer at the local animal shelter.

vocabulary.definition: to walk around without a specific destination
vocabulary.example_sentence: We like to wander through the park and see what we discover.

vocabulary.definition: the condition of the atmosphere at a particular time
vocabulary.example_sentence: The weather today is sunny and warm, perfect for a picnic.

vocabulary.definition: knowledge gained from experience and good judgment
vocabulary.example_sentence: Grandpa shared his wisdom about how to plant a successful garden.

vocabulary.definition: mental sharpness and cleverness
vocabulary.example_sentence: She used her quick wit to solve the riddle in seconds.

vocabulary.definition: the smallest part of a substance that still has its properties
vocabulary.example_sentence: A water molecule is made up of hydrogen and oxygen atoms.

vocabulary.definition: a particular type of matter with specific properties
vocabulary.example_sentence: Salt is a substance that dissolves easily in water.

vocabulary.definition: a test to find out if an idea is correct
vocabulary.example_sentence: Our science experiment tested which liquids freeze fastest.

vocabulary.definition: the process of wearing away rocks and soil by water or wind
vocabulary.example_sentence: Beach erosion happens when waves wash sand away from the shore.

vocabulary.definition: formed from cooled and hardened melted rock
vocabulary.example_sentence: Granite is an igneous rock that formed from cooled magma.

vocabulary.definition: a living thing that eats other living things for food
vocabulary.example_sentence: A rabbit is a consumer because it eats plants for energy.

vocabulary.definition: any living thing, such as a plant, animal, or bacteria
vocabulary.example_sentence: Every organism in the pond depends on clean water to survive.

vocabulary.definition: a pure substance made of only one type of atom
vocabulary.example_sentence: Gold is an element that doesn't rust or tarnish.

vocabulary.definition: facts or information that prove something is true
vocabulary.example_sentence: The footprints in the mud were evidence that deer visited our garden.

vocabulary.definition: to decide something based on facts or evidence
vocabulary.example_sentence: From our experiment, we can conclude that plants need sunlight to grow.

vocabulary.definition: to study something carefully to understand it better
vocabulary.example_sentence: Let's analyze the data to see which plant grew the tallest.

vocabulary.definition: the way something is built or organized
vocabulary.example_sentence: The structure of a bird's wing helps it fly efficiently.

vocabulary.definition: the job or purpose of something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The function of roots is to absorb water and nutrients for the plant.

vocabulary.definition: to set up or create something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The pioneers worked hard to establish a new town in the wilderness.

vocabulary.definition: to come out or appear from somewhere
vocabulary.example_sentence: The butterfly will emerge from its cocoon in the spring.

vocabulary.definition: to give or add something to help
vocabulary.example_sentence: Everyone can contribute ideas to make our class project better.

vocabulary.definition: to explain the meaning of something
vocabulary.example_sentence: Can you interpret what this poem is trying to say?

vocabulary.definition: something that influences a result or decision
vocabulary.example_sentence: Sunlight is an important factor in how well plants grow.

vocabulary.definition: to change or be different
vocabulary.example_sentence: The colors of autumn leaves vary from red to yellow to brown.

vocabulary.definition: to get or acquire something
vocabulary.example_sentence: We need to obtain permission before going on the field trip.

vocabulary.definition: the conditions or facts that affect a situation
vocabulary.example_sentence: Under normal circumstances, we walk to school every day.

vocabulary.definition: important or meaningful
vocabulary.example_sentence: Getting an A on the test was a significant achievement for Tim.

vocabulary.definition: to keep something in good condition
vocabulary.example_sentence: We must maintain our bikes by keeping them clean and oiled.

vocabulary.definition: a particular order of things or events
vocabulary.example_sentence: Follow the sequence of steps to solve the math problem correctly.

vocabulary.definition: to give out or spread things to different people or places
vocabulary.example_sentence: The teacher will distribute the art supplies to each student.

vocabulary.definition: something that is more important than other things
vocabulary.example_sentence: Studying for the big test should be your top priority this week.

vocabulary.definition: enough or satisfactory for what is needed
vocabulary.example_sentence: Make sure you get adequate sleep before the big game tomorrow.

vocabulary.definition: an idea or principle
vocabulary.example_sentence: The concept of gravity explains why things fall to the ground.

vocabulary.definition: the place where something comes from
vocabulary.example_sentence: The sun is our main source of light and heat on Earth.

vocabulary.definition: to carry out or perform an activity
vocabulary.example_sentence: The scientist will conduct an experiment to test her hypothesis.

vocabulary.definition: in addition to what has already been said
vocabulary.example_sentence: The weather is perfect for a picnic; furthermore, we have all day free.

vocabulary.definition: despite what has just been said
vocabulary.example_sentence: It was raining hard; nevertheless, we decided to go hiking.

vocabulary.definition: a group of things that are similar
vocabulary.example_sentence: Dogs and cats belong to the category of pets.

vocabulary.definition: to have a strong effect on something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The heavy rains will impact our plans for the outdoor concert.

vocabulary.definition: to build or make something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The students will construct a model bridge using popsicle sticks.

vocabulary.definition: close to a number or amount but not exactly
vocabulary.example_sentence: There are approximately 100 students in our grade level.

vocabulary.definition: clearly defined or identified; particular
vocabulary.example_sentence: Please give me a specific example of what you mean.

vocabulary.definition: to produce or create something
vocabulary.example_sentence: Wind turbines generate electricity from the power of moving air.

vocabulary.definition: correct and exact
vocabulary.example_sentence: It's important to give accurate measurements when following a recipe.

vocabulary.definition: absolutely necessary; extremely important
vocabulary.example_sentence: Water is essential for all living things to survive.

vocabulary.definition: to answer or react to something
vocabulary.example_sentence: Please respond to the teacher's question when called upon.

vocabulary.definition: having many parts; complicated
vocabulary.example_sentence: The human brain is a complex organ with billions of nerve cells.

vocabulary.definition: to happen or take place
vocabulary.example_sentence: Thunderstorms usually occur during hot summer afternoons.

vocabulary.definition: to show or point out something
vocabulary.example_sentence: Dark clouds indicate that rain is coming soon.

vocabulary.definition: to need something
vocabulary.example_sentence: This recipe will require three cups of flour and two eggs.

vocabulary.definition: to successfully complete or accomplish something
vocabulary.example_sentence: With hard work and practice, you can achieve your goals.

vocabulary.definition: a part that makes up something larger
vocabulary.example_sentence: Each component of the bicycle has an important job to do.

vocabulary.definition: another choice or option
vocabulary.example_sentence: If it rains, we have an alternative plan to play games indoors.

vocabulary.definition: a particular way of doing something skillfully
vocabulary.example_sentence: The artist used a special technique to make the painting look realistic.

vocabulary.definition: working well without wasting time or energy
vocabulary.example_sentence: The new dishwasher is very efficient and saves both water and electricity.

vocabulary.definition: on the outside of something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The external walls of the house are painted blue.

vocabulary.definition: on the inside of something
vocabulary.example_sentence: The doctor used a special camera to see the internal organs.

vocabulary.definition: good, helpful, or optimistic
vocabulary.example_sentence: Her positive attitude helped the team work better together.

vocabulary.definition: bad, harmful, or pessimistic
vocabulary.example_sentence: The negative effects of pollution harm the environment.

vocabulary.definition: something good or helpful that you get
vocabulary.example_sentence: One benefit of exercise is that it makes your muscles stronger.

vocabulary.definition: to make something new
vocabulary.example_sentence: The artist will create a beautiful sculpture from clay.

vocabulary.definition: to plan how something will look or work
vocabulary.example_sentence: The architect will design a new playground for our school.

vocabulary.definition: very important or large
vocabulary.example_sentence: Winning the championship was a major achievement for our team.

vocabulary.definition: small or not very important
vocabulary.example_sentence: Don't worry about that minor mistake; it's easy to fix.

vocabulary.definition: happening not long ago
vocabulary.example_sentence: The recent snowstorm caused school to be cancelled yesterday.

vocabulary.definition: happening before the current time
vocabulary.example_sentence: In the previous chapter, we learned about butterflies.

vocabulary.definition: happening now
vocabulary.example_sentence: The current weather is perfect for playing outside.

vocabulary.definition: happening at the same times or in the same way
vocabulary.example_sentence: We have regular fire drills once a month at school.

vocabulary.definition: able to be used or obtained
vocabulary.example_sentence: Extra pencils are available in the supply box if you need one.

vocabulary.definition: to get ready for something
vocabulary.example_sentence: We need to prepare our costumes for the school play.

vocabulary.definition: to intend or plan to do something
vocabulary.example_sentence: I purpose to finish my homework before watching TV.

vocabulary.definition: certainly and without doubt
vocabulary.example_sentence: I will definitely attend your birthday party on Saturday.

vocabulary.definition: especially or more than usual
vocabulary.example_sentence: I particularly enjoy reading mystery books over other genres.

vocabulary.definition: at first, in the beginning
vocabulary.example_sentence: The house was originally painted white, but now it's blue.

vocabulary.definition: in the end, after some time
vocabulary.example_sentence: If you keep practicing, you will eventually learn to ride the bike.
